Package org.opennars.inference

Class CompositionalRules

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opennars.inference.CompositionalRules
  • public final class CompositionalRules
extends Object
    Compound term composition and decomposition rules, with two premises.

    New compound terms are introduced only in forward inference, while decompositional rules are also used in backward inference

    Author:
    Pei Wang, Patrick Hammer

    • Constructor Summary

      • composeCompound

        static void composeCompound​(Statement taskContent,
                            Statement beliefContent,
                            int index,
                            DerivationContext nal)
        {<S ==> M>, <P ==> M>} |-
        {<(S|P) ==> M>, <(S&P) ==> M>, <(S-P) ==> M>, <(P-S) ==> M>}
        Parameters:
        taskContent - The first premise
        beliefContent - The second premise
        index - The location of the shared term
        nal - Reference to the memory

      • processComposed

                                    Term subject,
                                    Term predicate,
                                    int order,
                                    TruthValue truth,
                                    DerivationContext nal)
        Finish composing implication term
        Parameters:
        statement - Type of the contentInd
        subject - Subject of contentInd
        predicate - Predicate of contentInd
        truth - TruthValue of the contentInd
        nal - Reference to the memory

      • decomposeCompound

        private static void decomposeCompound​(CompoundTerm compound,
                                      Term component,
                                      Term term1,
                                      int index,
                                      boolean compoundTask,
                                      int order,
                                      DerivationContext nal)
        {<(S|P) ==> M>, <P ==> M>} |- <S ==> M>
        Parameters:
        term1 - The other term in the contentInd
        index - The location of the shared term: 0 for subject, 1 for predicate
        compoundTask - Whether the implication comes from the task
        nal - Reference to the memory

                                 Statement beliefContent,
                                 int index,

        {<S --> P1>, <S --> P2>} |- (&&, <#x --> P1>, <#x --> P2>)
        Parameters:
        taskContent - The first premise <M --> S>
        beliefContent - The second premise <M --> P>
        index - The location of the shared term: 0 for subject, 1 for predicate

      • introVarInner

        static boolean introVarInner​(Statement premise1,
                             Statement premise2,
                             CompoundTerm oldCompound,
                             DerivationContext nal)

        {<M --> S>, (&&, C, <M --> P>)} |- (&&, C, <<#x --> S> ==> <#x --> P>>)
        Parameters:
        oldCompound - The whole contentInd of the first premise, Implication or Conjunction
        nal - Reference to the memory
